verses.roman:
anyebhyaś cāśva-cāṇḍāla-
patitebhyo yathārhataḥ
yavasaṁ ca gavāṁ dattvā
giraye dīyatāṁ baliḥ

synonyms: anyebhyaḥ—to the others; ca—also; ā-śva-cāṇḍāla—even down to the dogs and the dog-eaters; patitebhyaḥ—to such fallen persons; yathā—as; arhataḥ—is proper in each case; yavasam—grass; ca—and; gavām—to the cows; dattvā—having given; giraye—to the mountain called Govardhana; dīyatām—should be presented; baliḥ—respectful offerings.
translation: After giving the appropriate food to everyone else, including such fallen souls as dogs and dog-eaters, you should give grass to the cows and then present your respectful offerings to Govardhana Hill.
